START: ^I'm excited to work at Voidpet Dungeon primarily because of my love for turn based RPGs and my own experience with mental health.
POKEMON: ^I started playing PokÃ©mon games around the age of 8 because I was fortunate to have an older brother who was obsessed with the franchise. I canâ€™t exactly remember my first game, but Iâ€™ve played the games from about every generation of PokÃ©mon.

^Beyond the stock games, I got really big on ROM hacksâ€”modified and custom versions of the original games with new PokÃ©mon, new characters and new storylines which I found maximized the user experience.
RPGS_NOW: ^I definitely donâ€™t play RPGs as often as I used to (still love the Persona series though if youâ€™ve heard of it) and Iâ€™m fine with that! â€œIâ€™m too old for video games.â€ ğŸ˜‚ But one regret I have is not making my own ROM hack or RPG when I was younger.
^Regret about not making your own RPG
REGRET: ^To me, probably the only thing more intricate than coding up and shipping a product as a software engineer is coding up and shipping a successful video gameâ€”a sprite and turn based one at that!
^I truly want to experience the ups and downs that come with this kind of software development and the upkeep of such a game.

^Creating characters and features, sifting through channels of users and bugs they found, sifting through channels of users who think they found a bug, but there WiFi was just turned off; this may speak a lot to who I am, but I shamelessly think that sounds like a ton of fun.
MENTAL: ^Beyond that, when considering Voidpet Dungeon is a game that platforms mental health in a digestible, destigmatized way and acknowledging my own mental health struggles that I worked through in college, I really believe that working on Voidpet Dungeon would be a truly transformative opportunity.

^Although I would always have Voidpets like Ambition and Determination by my side, Pain and Anxious would definitely be following very closely behind to say the least. I think much of my own journey with mental health has been trying to normalize, accept and grow with the Voidpets (and emotions) that I would in past try to avoid and fight off with a Super Soak or Bubble Blast. This is all to say, if I can become an active member in Voidpet Dungeon's continued success and play a role putting the game in the hands of others who love RPGs and know the weight of mental health, nothing would excite me more.
